action.action-desc: Ms. Van Duyne (for herself, Mr. Weber of Texas, Mrs. Flores, Mr. Van Drew, Mrs. Fischbach, Mr. Carey, and Ms. Foxx) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Appropriations

form.official-title: To transfer certain amounts authorized to be appropriated for foreign assistance to the Department of Homeland Security for programs securing the southern border of the United States, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Border Patrol First Act.

Of the unobligated balances of amounts made available to the Department of State for refugee and migration assistance and for humanitarian assistance in Central America, $240,000,000 shall be transferred to and merged with amounts made available to the Department of Homeland Securityâ€”

paragraph.text: for the programs, projects, and activities of U.S. Customs and Border Protection along the southern international border of the United States; and
to reimburse the States of Texas and Arizona for programs, projects, or activities conducted by such States relating to securing the southern international border of the United States.
